paper.title: Variance reduction for policy gradient with action-dependent factorized baselines

analysis.memory_insight: Peak DRAM usage was estimated at 3.8 GB, utilizing FP16 and 8-bit quantization, resulting in a 28% reduction in memory usage compared to a baseline without optimization. Memory bandwidth requirements were approximately 16 GB/s. The analysis suggests a strong focus on memory efficiency to enable deployment on resource-constrained platforms.
analysis.engineering_takeaway: Action-dependent factorized baselines, combined with memory quantization techniques (FP16 and 8-bit), offer a significant pathway to reducing memory footprint and improving the training stability and efficiency of policy gradient methods.  Careful consideration of gradient clipping and learning rate scheduling is also crucial.
